description: This walk visits Bovey Castle, a Grade II listed mansion in the Dartmoor National Park. The house is now a hotel but you can book an aftertoon tea and enjoy a stroll around the lovely grounds and gardens. There are pleasant trails along the River Bovey and around the pretty lakes with views across the Dartmoor countryside to enjoy. Head south east and you can visit nearby North Bovey village and pick up the epic Dartmoor Way. Other local walking highlights include the splendid Lustleigh Cleave, the popular Becky Falls and the fascinating stone stack at Bowerman's Nose. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Bovey Castle. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.
display_address: Bovey Castle, Yard Hill, Olde Yard, North Bovey, Teignbridge, Devon, England, TQ13 8RE, United Kingdom
